This paper presents an unsupervised learning algorithm for sense disambiguation that , when trained on unannotated English text , rivals the performance of supervised techniques that require time - consuming hand annotations .The algorithm is based on two powerful constraints -- that words tend to have one sense per discourse and one sense per collocation -- exploited in an iterative bootstrapping procedure .
